reviews.text: Would eat there again
Love this place! Frozen Mango Margaritas‚Ä¶.Amazing!!! Great after work spotüôåüèΩ
All I gotta say is I paid $18 for two shots of Bacardi LMAO
Best nachos I've had in NYC so far.

T√≠pico bar americano, cero turistas, ya que est√° en una zona apartada del tr√°nsito de turistas. La comida muy buena, la camarera fue amable. La cantidad de comida incluso excesiva y de precio, bien para lo caro que es todo en Nueva York. Sitio recomendable.
Good for late night drinks, lots of options and both food and drinks are super good. Staff very friendly
Fabulous music!

Food was not good. Everything was super greasy and had no flavor. Onion rings were inedible; sent them back. Waiter brought us the wrong entrees and took them back after we started eating the fries; I hope they didn't give them to the people that actually ordered them. Onion rings were left in the bill; had to request them to be removed. Great decor but super loud, clientele AND staff. Won't be back; waste of money.

This was a terrible experience. One of the bouncers actually threatened to hurt me just because he wasn‚Äôt getting attention from the younger girls in our group. On top of that, his coworkers came over and falsely accused me of being loud. Completely unprofessional, unsafe, and hostile environment. Terrible people and service ‚Äî do not go here, especially if you‚Äôre a guy with female friends.

I love this place you come in this place in your transported back to the 70s, exposed brick decorated with sea horses. The food is good and the drinks are great. After you finish eating  you can talk a nice walk on the Brooklyn Bridge.
8/28/25 two for the most friendly bar tenders and the wings were perfect

Great place, and where I first heard about the famous painting they have hanging on the wall

This painting is known as ‚ÄúThe Guardian of the Highway‚Äù, created in the late 1970s by an anonymous roadside artist who was once a long-haul trucker himself. Legend has it that after narrowly surviving a catastrophic accident in the Nevada desert, the man claimed to have seen a vision: a figure of Christ appearing above his wrecked rig, arms outstretched in both welcome and protection.

He gave up trucking soon after and began painting devotional works in small towns along the interstate. Unlike traditional religious art, his subjects always merged the divine with the world of the road‚Äîchrome, diesel, and endless highways. This particular piece, featuring a gleaming blue semi beneath the blessing hands of Christ, became a favorite among truck stops and diners across the Midwest, where it was seen as a talisman for safe passage.

Truckers whispered that those who carried a copy of this painting‚Äîor even a photograph of it‚Äîwould find themselves spared from breakdowns and bad weather. Some said that if you looked closely at the truck‚Äôs headlights, they seemed to glow faintly in the dark, like guiding beacons on a lonely highway.

Today, ‚ÄúThe Guardian of the Highway‚Äù survives as folk-art legend: equal parts roadside spirituality, Americana, and the weary hope of those who live their lives between the mile markers"
Cool vibes and nice Brooklyn Bridge view
The best staff - we had so much fun chatting with Eamon and Rob!

Just what the dr ordered!
A must visit place if you have been drinking and forget to eat!! Friendly staff and very tasty foodü§û

Went around midnight and was pretty busy still but the service was so fast and extremely friendly bartender. He was on top of everything and even brought our drinks to our table. Fantastic place a 2 minute walk to the Brooklyn bridge entrance.
Super fun spot way down at the tip of Manhattan ! Great crowd and vibe!
Nice Restaurant
Wanted to like this place more than I did. Overpriced for ‚Äúmid‚Äù quality food. Bottled beer was warm.
Tex mex grub with a seafood twist (hey it's at the seaport) a stiff pour at the bar and live music Mondays and Tuesdays. Kitchen open late!
House margaritas are fantastic!
Don't mess with the mystery shot. Sharkarita is all you need. One bathroom is a full room color-blind exam... but also bubbly sea foam. There were zero mermaids. Sad. There were zero seahorses. Sad.
Have no idea why the waiter this evening was so rude. The attitude was such a problem, we left before ordering food because we felt so uncomfortable. Hope he is okay.
The signature Shark Drink is a MUST try here! They also make a mean frozen margarita, that you can chose your flavor! Service was excellent!
The drinks and service was great.
great place to go before a concert at pier 17 - the bartender was soooo nice and calm even though the place was packed

We randomly found this place and were not disappointed.
A little gem. They have a good selection of tap beer, and a well stocked bar.
The food was exceptional, and service was second to none. 10/10 would highly recommend, and if we make it back to NYC from the UK will be back for more.
I remember when no one knew about this place. (Or I just went later than the rush). So good to see it getting so much love.
Bad service experience. Been here before 4*, but this experience was pitiful. If you want a 20% tip, show some respect and work your tables.

I was excited to try this place but I had a really bad experience with the hostess from the start. I had an empty soda in my hand and she said no outside drinks and I said that's ok I'm done and she said ok you can go throw it out outside...I couldn't throw it out inside. She said I had to walk out and find a public trash can to be able to sit down??? CRAZY
Great little bar. .
Best place to go in seaport when you need a frozen drink and bar snacks galore
Really nice little place with amazing food!
Original local dive bar. Great place, and mostly locals hang here. Shrimp tacos are fantastic.

Super fun and cute restaurant! Staff was very nice and attentive. The decor was so good and the food was great! The wings were amazing! Jalape√±o poppers and enchiladas were great too. It was definitely Tex-mex so a little different than my favorite classic Mexican food, but still great! Music was fun. Will be going back! And it‚Äôs an affordable dinner in Manhattan so 10/10
good!!
Wonderfully fun place
So much fun, great vibes and amazing band
Waited and waited and waited. Nobody brought my food or my water or my drink. Left after waiting for 45 min or so. Not coming back
The best Superb Owl party EVAH FLY EGGLES FLY!
a 5 stars place
Love this little dive bar! Tex mex mixed with Nola cuisine! Would 100% come back!
a 5 stars place

Tr√®s bon et bonnes portions ! bon service !

Mais de mauvaise fois pour les tips (20% automatiques m√™me pour une petite table,  et surtout, calcul√©s sur le TTC !)

Assez de restaurants en ville pour √©viter ce genre de mauvaise fois :/
What can I say, I'm a Seahorse gal!
10/10 there was a dog
Awesome service, great food

Nestled in the easternmost edge of the seaport, just under the Brooklyn Bridge, you‚Äôll find this inconspicuous little gem. They serve unpretentious Tex Mex sprinkled with seafood and burgers. I only tried the nachos but they were absolutely stellar. The beef was high quality, the guacamole was amazing and they make their own hot sauces. The green sauce was my fave. Sadly they don‚Äôt bottle the hot sauce for retail sale, or I‚Äôd purchase a couple. I can‚Äôt wait to return and try the burgers, I saw several of them hustled past me, one with gigantic fluffy onion rings. They looked as good as any burger I‚Äôve seen. This place came highly recommended and it lived up to the hype. Great job.

Loved the Seahorse decorations and the nautical vibe.  The place was hopping on Saturday.  I didn't try the food.  The prices on the drinks were very reasonable, especially for The Seaport area.  The service was good.  I have to come back to try their food and spend more time here.
Wonderful place. Eclectic decor, friendly staff, and most importantly,  the food was fantastic.  Highly recommend this neighborhood place for future patrons.
Good atmosphere down by seaport for drinks and Mexican food. Food was decent. Served was great and my friends and I had a blast gettin a lil tipsy (like everybody in the club)

this was a random stop, and it was amazing! We were down by the pier for a tour, and decide to look up a local place to grab a good bite. We strolled in, sat outside in a perfect environment, had a fantastic waiter, and amazing food. I would‚Äôve called this a perfect New York dinner

This place was awesome.  Total non-touristy place to go in Fidi for some great eats. The coconut shrimp were phenomenal and the margaritas hit hard. The decor and theme is also truly one of a kind and can't be replicated.

Nice food on a competitive trivia night! We came there on a Wednesday night and didn‚Äôt know there would be a one-hour trivia night, which was quite fun and not too loud. The food was good, quite authentic, our friend even said, ‚Äúthe‚Ä¶

There was hair in my quesadilla and that was it for me. Drinks were okay, took about 15 minutes for our orders to be taken after being seated. Wasn‚Äôt packed, low every server. Disappointing and I won‚Äôt be returning. I don‚Äôt recommend

I go here often, close to my job. Food is good and quick! Nice place to go and relax a decent view of the bridge from below. Quiet area off the beaten path to say. I would say it is def a hidden gem. Margaritas and nachos are favorite‚Ä¶

A random choice for lunch before our harbor cruise. The name caught our attention and it was an awesome find. The eclectic decor added to the charm, who doesn't love Seahorses? The food was delicious and portions were large. The location nestled under the Brooklyn Bridge was very cool.

Friendly staff! I love the vibe here. We got the blackened fish, stuffed jalapeno (can‚Äôt remember what it‚Äôs called but it was so gooood!!!), and the shrimp basket for kids. everything was amazing! ofcourse the margaritas too!
This is my go to every time I‚Äôm in Financial District/Seaport! They are always friendly, drinks/food are great. The black bean nachos and margaritas are my go to

Went for taco Tuesday. The shrimp tacos were blah but the ground beef ones were decent for the special. The vibe and location is great. It‚Äôs really nice in the inside. It‚Äôs a really random spot for a texmex spot. Will def be back for another drink soon.

We went there for dinner and had a really great time.

The service was particularly friendly and the food really amazing.

I had the schrimps with grips and it was as tasty as it can be.

My wife ordered the enchiladas and there were excellent too.

For dessert I chose the peanut butter pie and it was amazing. Meanwhile my wife tried the brownie (I tasted it :p) and it was delicious.

Definitely a good adress because the price was also not expensive regarding the quality (around 25$ per person for a main course and dessert)

Moreover the atmosphere was very fun and there is a quiz game every Wednesday.

Waitress very rude, throwing things, answering with anger. When I asked if everything was ok with her she said: ‚Äúwe‚Äôre understaffed , I‚Äôm alone today, how about that?‚Äù
Had just arrived at the city and went from the airport to this place with my family and was a terrible choice.

I‚Äôve been coming to CGSH since 2004 when I stumbled upon it while checking out the historical buildings around the Brooklyn Bridge. It has an eclectic vibe, good food, and the best service - bar none. Do yourself a favor and visit this venerable place when in NYC. You can thank me later.

Very cool hidden spot full of locals in an area that is quickly becoming popular. Strongly recommend the coconut shrimp. But they are truly famous for their 30+ types of margaritas. Good spot to bring a friend or bring a group for a chill night
It was a lovely family friendly place to have dinner broad menu exactly as advertised with amazing staff. Aaron was incredible A+++
Excellent frozen margaritas during happy hour. Ordered the classic lime one and raspberry too. Food was delicoous. Ordered wings, fried chicken and fries. Fun vibe and good drinks.

Got my Tex-Mex fix . Oh how I‚Äôve missed you so , Queso . Had that  little extra kick which makes all the difference . You‚Äôll relish every bite .
Tacos are  tasty too but the quac that came on the side wasn‚Äôt great .  Looked and tasted like it wasn‚Äôt made fresh .
Nice to sit outside . Attentive waiter and was thankful for the to go drink when I left .   Maybe consider adding DP, Big Red , Lone Star to complete the experience ?
I‚Äôve been to Cowgirl  for chicken friend steak several times and just found out about this sister restaurant for Tex Mex . So if you like this one you‚Äôll like that one too . Both Cowgirls know their way around the kitchen .

Right by the Brooklyn Bridge. The decor is funky and fun. We only had appetizers and drinks. The jalapeno poppers were actually kind of spicy, really liked them. Fries were also pretty good. The drinks were alright, nothing to write home about. The mint in one drink was a little wilted/rotten, but good otherwise.

Total leckeres Essen, sehr nette Bedienung und echt gute Aussicht auf die Manhattan Bridge.
Viele Getr√§nke for free einfach zum Probieren. Gestern war wohl Tequila-Day.

Happy hour is on point. The frozen margaritas were delicious! Food is lackluster and fairly expensive, and points were lost only on it. Waitstaff and bartenders quite friendly and accomodating. The ambiance is kitschy and definitely seems‚Ä¶

Restaurant trouv√© par hasard apr√®s notre balade sur le Brooklyn bridge. Le soir ou nous y √©tions il y avait une soir√©e trivia, tr√®s bruyante, mais conviviale. Le menu enfant √©tait top et nous nous sommes r√©gal√©s ! Mention sp√©ciale pour le personnel, tr√®s chaleureux

Staff was super nice, place was beautiful. Unfortunately I wasn‚Äôt hungry because I would love to have tried everything. Frozen margarita with strawberry was great and the guacamole too (though the Tortillas were soso). Would definitely come back with friends to have drinks but am also hoping to get a meal there.

Ottimi burger...praticamente sotto il ponte di Brooklyn...in una delle pi√π antiche e genuine zone di N.Y.C. Personale molto gentile. Nella bella stagione √® piacevole mangiare fuori...anche se i tavolini sono minuscoli, merita per l'atmosfera!

Me and my friend were visiting NYC from LA, we found this place while visiting the Brooklyn Bridge on the date of my BD and it was our last day in NYC. Nice outdoor seating area. The food was amazing, we loved their smoke grilled chicken‚Ä¶
Really good food and affordable; however, they seem short-staffed.
Super fast service and the food is CRAZY good. Worth the stop!!!

Bar and restaurant with a lot of character.  In an old building in the south street seaport just below the Brooklyn bridge.  Very creative and tasty seafood along with some of the usual dishes.  Oyster po boy, white fish Reuben and fish and‚Ä¶
